name: relax
content:
relax verb
(PERSON)
Add to word list
Add to word list
B1 [ I or T ] to (cause someone to) become less active and more calm and happy: After work she relaxed with a cup of tea and the newspaper. By and large, cooking relaxes me.

[ I or T ] to (cause a part of the body) to become less stiff: A good massage will relax your tired muscles. Muscles in the throat relax during sleep, causing shallow or obstructed breathing.
More examplesFewer examplesShe lay back in the dentist's chair and tried to relax.I was relaxing in the bath, having toiled away in the garden all afternoon.After work, they relaxed by going to the pub.Don't tense your shoulders, just relax.I like to relax with a pipe of an evening.
